lgp.core.evolution.fitness

Class FitnessFunctions

  • lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessFunctions

  • public class FitnessFunctions

    A collection of standard fitness functions.

    Custom fitness functions can be defined by creating any function with a type of class FitnessFunction.

    See Also:
    class FitnessFunction

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static FitnessFunctions INSTANCE
      A collection of standard fitness functions.
      static double UNDEFINED_FITNESS
      Large constant value for fitness in the cases when either a program is un-evaluated or the fitness computation overflows.

    • Method Summary

    • Field Detail

      • UNDEFINED_FITNESS

        public static double UNDEFINED_FITNESS

        Large constant value for fitness in the cases when either a program is un-evaluated or the fitness computation overflows.

      • INSTANCE

        public static FitnessFunctions INSTANCE

        A collection of standard fitness functions.

        Custom fitness functions can be defined by creating any function with a type of class FitnessFunction.

        See Also:
        class FitnessFunction

    • Method Detail

      • getMAE

        public static FitnessFunction<java.lang.Double,lgp.core.program.Outputs.Single> getMAE()

        Mean absolute error fitness function.

        Simply sums up the absolute differences between the outputs and takes the mean.

      • getSSE

        public static FitnessFunction<java.lang.Double,lgp.core.program.Outputs.Single> getSSE()

        Sum-of-squared errors fitness function.

        Simply calculates the sum of the squared error between the actual and expected outputs.

      • getMSE

        public static FitnessFunction<java.lang.Double,lgp.core.program.Outputs.Single> getMSE()

        Mean-Squared Error fitness function for programs that operate on doubles.

        Calculates the sum of squared errors and then takes the mean.

      • getRMSE

        public static FitnessFunction<java.lang.Double,lgp.core.program.Outputs.Single> getRMSE()

        Root Mean-Squared Error fitness function for programs that operate on doubles.

        Essentially operates by computing the MSE, then taking the square-root of the result.

      • getCE

        public static kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1,lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessFunction> getCE()

        Classification Error fitness function for programs that operate on doubles.

        This function requires a function that maps the continuous program output to a discrete class value, as specified by the mappingFunction parameter.

        See Also:
        mappingFunction

      • getThresholdCE

        public static kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<java.lang.Double,lgp.core.evolution.fitness.FitnessFunction> getThresholdCE()

        Threshold Classification Error fitness function.

        This fitness function works by counting the number of outputs which have an error difference greater than a given threshold. Error differences which fall beneath the threshold are considered to be "good" solutions.

        The field expects to be passed a threshold for differentiating good/bad solutions, specified through the threshold parameter.

        See Also:
        threshold
